text: My seven-year-old goddaughter and I sit in a café, more than a mile from Seward Park, but still holding Sqebeqsed in mind. I read her Denise Levertov's poem "Settling." She tips her head at the line "Grey is the price / of neighboring with eagles." This child has always lived close to eagles, always cupped small hands around her eyebrows on sunny days and complained of rays piercing her eyes. She is confused. How is that a price? she wants to know.
excerpt: My seven-year-old goddaughter and I sit in a café, more than a mile from Seward Park, but still holding Sqebeqsed in mind.
title: Empire Espresso
